page.title: 05Ecology (cont)
page.content: In the 300 acres of meadowland known as Beading Brooks rare plants are found. The reed warbler has been seen here and on the Downs, larks, hawks and many other birds are to be found. In the weald there have been complaints from residents of side effects of crop spraying, some sore throats and sickness. There has been unsympathetic drainage in Beeding Brooks this year by choosing the wrong months and thereby disturbing wildlife Motorcross takes place at the rear of Golding Barn Farm which considerably scars the Downland landscape. Stubble burning is also unpopular with the walkers.
